title: How to differentiate test, evaluation, measurement, and assessment - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s say you are trying to determine the effectiveness of an information campaign to the public. Here’s the procedure: Test: Record the media you have used to send out the information campaign. Also record what media the responding population used to reach you in regard to that campaign. Evaluation: Quantify resources spent on different media resources used and quantify public response based on which media outlets used to reach out in regards to the campaign Measurement: Create graphs/charts/tables to show the correlation between media outlets and positive/negative response from the public Assessment: Analyze the graphs/charts/tables to determine what is working to reach the intended population, what is having no effect and what may be having a negative effect. Correct your procedure as needed to determine the most effective procedure going forward.
